definition: feelings and sensibilities/sentiment and face/sensitivity to other's feelings
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: It is not good to have respect of persons in judgment.
sentences.chinese: 審判時看人的情面，是不好的。

sentences.english: Of people could not understand, Chavez does not always seem to leave some feelings to each other.
sentences.chinese: 對看不慣的人，查韋斯似乎總是不給對方留一點情面。

sentences.english: In the arena but not off place, you can do not fear aches!
sentences.chinese: 競技場可是不講情面的地方哦，可不要怕疼啊。

sentences.english: Still favor this don't show consideration noodles as person?
A second student, called Zhao, was unsparing.
sentences.chinese: 另一個學生，姓趙，說得非常不留情面。

sentences.english: There is no love lost between Wenger and Pearce.
sentences.chinese: 在溫格與皮爾斯之間並無任何情面好講。

sentences.english: It is not good to be partial to the wicked or to deprive the innocent of justice.
sentences.chinese: 瞻徇惡人的情面，偏斷義人的案件，都爲不善。

sentences.english: It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow the righteous in judgment.
sentences.chinese: 瞻徇惡人的情面，偏斷義人的案件，都爲不善。

sentences.english: When he punishes me he really punishes me.
sentences.chinese: 當他懲罰我的時候一點情面也不留。

sentences.english: Time will never change and stop for any person.
sentences.chinese: 贓羜時間不給任何人情面，也不會爲誰而停留。

definition: my meager sensibilities/blushing face/please do it for my sake (i.e. to save my face)(humble)
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
lit. not for the monk's sake but for the Buddha's sake (idiom)/fig. (to do sth for sb) out of deference to sb else
pinyin: bu4 kan4 seng1 mian4 kan4 fo2 mian4

definition: to relent (to spare sb's feelings)/to show mercy or forgiveness/to forbear/lenient
to leave room to maneuver/to leave a margin for error
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
(in the expression 看在…的份上) for the sake of .../considering ...
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to intercede/to plead for sb else
